page.title: 07Religion
page.content: In Hassall Green there is a Chapel and a Church. The Weslyan Chapel built in 1858 when the area was stongly non conformist. The Church of St. Philips, painted pink was erected in 1883 after being transfered from Alsager on a horse and cart. 50 years ago both chapel and church could be full on Sundays. The Church Hall built 50 years ago provides the villiage with a villiage hall. All denominations go to the Church Sunday School. The Church is now part of the Parish of Wheelock. The average communion congregation is 6-12 and evensong 12-24, with holiday makers from the canal barges raising the congragation in holiday time. There is no Church orChapel in Malkins BAnk. A Chapel built in 1915 which used to be full every Sunday is now used as a store by Jefferies the packing firm.
